result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Hines Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas L Hines Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas L Hines Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Thomas L Hines Jr was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Thomas L Hines Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Joint and several with co-defendant Ryan Kitchmaster (14CF73).
Defendant to pay court costs within the first 6 months of probation.

Probation and Parole not to place geographical restrictions for the defendant's employment.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
Expunction granted under 973.015 - clerk to expunge record upon receiving discharge paperwork (certificate) from P&P.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first year of probation. As deemed appropriate by P&P.

records.addlTxt: Called at 8:45 AM. Thomas Hines Jr appears in person and with counsel Greg Seibold. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements and victim(2) are in the courtroom and may make statement - amend count #8 to misd criminal damage to property contrary to 943.01(1), defendant to plead g/nc to counts #7 as alleged, #8 as amended and #10 as alleged and remaining counts to be dismissed - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA, 50 hours of community service, responsible to pay half restitution submitted ($2572.23) to be paid today with the other half being paid by co-defendant (Ryan Kitchmaster - 14CF73), allow the defendant to be able to work outside State of WI is necessary, upon successful completion of probation - eligible for expunction, restitution total is $5144.45 which includes VW surcharge (breakdown in court record). Seibold and Hines agree. Court informs counsel that he will consider argument for expunction for stated reasons but may not order it. Court amends count #8 to misd criminal damage contrary to 943.01(1) - reads new charge and penalty. Hines pleads NC to count #8 as amended and to counts #7 and #10 as alleged. Court dismisses counts #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6 and #9. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - understands Court's position on expunction but asks Court to grant it for stated reasons. Seibold makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Hines makes statement, remorseful. Court reviews submitted victim statement. Victim makes statement. Seibold makes additional comments in respond to victims statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #7, #8 and #9 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: costs on each count - paid within the first 6 months of probation, restitution of  $5144.45 ($2572.23 - paid today) - joint and several with 14CF73, AODA and follow thru, 50 hours of community service total - to be performed within the first year of probation, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school - P&P not to place geographical restriction for the defendants employment, expunction granted under 973.015 - clerk to expunge record upon receiving discharge paperwork from P&P, right to appeal, adjourned.

Dr. NS, Ministry Saint Mary's Hospital
Jury trial on January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Hines in court with attorney Gregory Paul Seibold.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:17 pm. No resolution - discovery issues with viewability of software from FOSO - continuing to trying to correct. Seibold agrees. Discussion on the discovery issue. Court believes that the state will resolve the issue with viewability. Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 8, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Called at 1:26 PM. Thomas Hines Jr appears in person and with counsel Greg Seibold. State appears by Charles Simono. State - discovery sent on 9/16/14 but has not made any offers as of today's date, suggest rescheduling to 10/8/14 at 3:15 PM. Court continues bond.
Final pre-trial on September 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 9:42 AM. Thomas Hines in court and  appears with Attorney Seibold. State by Jodi Bednar Clemens. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Seibold reviews Information, compares it to complaint, waives further reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 9/24/14 at 1:15 PM.

Called 5:38 pm. Thomas Hines in person and with counsel Gregory Seibold. State by Charles Simono. State calls Deputy Crum sworn & direct 5:39 pm. Seibold objects - court sustained 5:42 pm. Record reflect identification. Seibold request sequestration. Court grants 5:45 pm. Seibold cross - state objects Court overruled 5:51 pm. State will stipulate to Deputy has no knowledge of vehicle. State object (foundation) court sustained 5:54 pm. State object (relevance_ court - sustained 5:55 pm. Deputy Crum excused. 5:56 pm Deputy Hujet called/sworn and direct by state. Seibold objection (hearsay/foundation) court sustained 6:04 pm. Seibold object court overruled. Seibold cross 6:10 pm. State same stipulation witness know info on vehicle. 6:15 pm M.C. sworn/direct by state. Seibold cross 6:23 pm. State redirect 6:27 pm. R.E. sowrn/direct by state 6:29 pm. Seibold object overruled 6:35 pm. Seibold cross 6:45 pm. R.E. excused. R.N. sworn/direct 6:40 pm Seibold object - relevance overruled 6:45 pm. Seibold cross 6:50 pm. R.N. excused 6:55 pm. Seibold request felony counts be dismissed for stated reasons. State motion premature and asks court to deny motion. Court denies motion. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Bond continued. ARGN 8/20/14 @ 9:30 am. Adj 7 pm.

Called at 9:53 AM. Thomas Hines Jr appears in person and with counsel Greg Seibold. State appears by Jodi Bendar Clemens. Seibold has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, PH - 7/30/14 at 3:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
No contact with Ryan Enders, Marki Champine, Todd Howen or Ryan Nelson, no consumption of alcohol.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:13 AM. Thomas Hines Jr appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Hines will need an attorney appointed for him. Recess to talk to SPD prior to reading charges and penalties. Recalled at 10:09 AM. Hines does not qualify for SPD, court provides paperwork for court appointed, Hines states he will hire his own attorney. Hines has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Hines understands charges and penalties. Contact someone today and if not, fill out court appointed form and get back to Court ASAP.  Court sets for AIA on 7/16/14 at 9:00 AM. State - bond - $2000 signature bond, no contact with Ryan Enders, Marki Champine, Todd Howen or Ryan Nelson, no consumption of alcohol.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
